divs: sighting detailsat about 3 am on may 16 (timing can be found due to it being a confirmed report, listed in la times) i was getting out of the car to get a snack on my way home. i felt compelled to look up. i was standing within 140 meters of the west end of the orange county airport runway. i was facing north when i looked up. all subsequent activity happened toward the north and east. 5 "lights" i will refer to them as such because they were quite high up and i saw only white lights. these 5 lights were in what appeared to me to be a fixed position above me, nearly directly vertical, off by a degree or 2 perhaps. the were far too large to be stars, and far larger than venus. there is no chance i mistook them for stars. there was no noise to report. i heard only the environment around me, the airport was closed at this hour. 2 suddenly moved off to the north. so fast that they were gone from view (on a clear night) toward la county in a matter of seconds. i continued to watch the 3 that remained. they moved slightly, giving me a chance to try to triangulate the distance and estimate height. i can only say the height was likely 10k feet above me, at minimum. i had better than 20\15 vision at the time. the 2 lights returned to join the 3. they then moved in a line together in one direction, and then very suddenly changed direction moving toward san bernardino county. i could see well past saddleback mountain on this evening, and they moved toward sbc from the left of saddlebacks peak from my vantage point. the acceleration was slow when they started, moved to a point at a different angle, perhaps toward anaheim, then changed direction, and then within a second and a half at most, had moved out toward sbc and were gone from view. i watched them move 60 to 100 miles in a matter of 2 seconds. at no time can i recall their changing size or color, and they seemed to me to maintain the altitude when present above me. the movement toward anaheim seemed to be slightly upward, at a speed of several hundred miles an hour apparently, and the movement toward sbc at extreme high speed also seemed as though they were again gaining altitude. i informed the sheriff's office at the time, and approximately one week later read a report in the la times that both the oc and lax runways had had reported the sightings. 2 runway attendants at lax reported it, that i recall from the article. i can verify the event in time because the next day, i went to pick up my fiance at the airport, lax.
trends: There have been 28 other sightings in Irvine
There were no other sightings in Irvine on or around May 16th 1976
Object Flight Path: Stationary,Hovering then path,Straight-line path,Path with directional change
